results.title: Last of the Mohicans
results.creator_credit: Associated producers, Maurice Tourneur and Clarence Brown
results.brief_description: The setting is the wilderness of northern New York State during the French and Indian war of 1757. Two English women, daughters of a British officer, are captured by Indians. One of them, Cora, attracts the love of two Indians, one the noble Uncas (the ‘last’ Mohican) the other the villainous Magua. Underlying the romance of the fast moving, concise narrative are darker implications of miscegenation, the threat of rape and of unbridled savagery. This is widely considered to be the finest surviving example of Tourneur’s influential pictorial style although the film was actually directed by Clarence Brown under the close supervision of the injured Tourneur. Adapted from the novel by James Fenimore Cooper. Cast includes Barbara Bedford, Lillian Hall, Wallace Beery.

results.title: Last dance
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Steven Haft and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: After 12 years behind bars for a double murder, Cindy Liggett is prepared to die. What she is not prepared for is the relationship she develops with the man assigned to save her life, attorney Rick Hayes. Cast includes Sharon Stone, Rob Morrow, Randy Quaid, Peter Gallagher, Jack Thompson.

results.title: Laputa castle in the sky = Tenkuu no Shiro Rapyuta
results.creator_credit: Studio Ghibli, Isao Takahata, Tatsumi Yamashita and Hayao Miyazaki
results.brief_description: Children’s themed anime about a young girl fleeing pirates and corrupted government officials, who pursue her for a magical necklace that she wears. Pazu is the young boy who catches Sheeta as she floats down from the sky, and accompanies her on perilous adventures. Both seek Laputa, Sheeta’s ancestral home and a place of boyhood dreaming for Pazu, an elaborate and alluring Hayao airborne castle. Containing the visual spectacular feast that was the hallmark of “Spirited away”, Miyazaki presents an exciting adventure film, fleshing out his preoccupation with feisty (and imperilled) children, aeronautics and otherworldliness.

results.title: Land and Freedom = Tierra y Libertad
results.creator_credit: Parallax Films, Messidor Films, Road Movies Dritte Produktionen, Rebecca O'Brien and Ken Loach
results.brief_description: Land and freedom traces the life of unemployed Liverpool lad David (Ian Hart) who, sick of English pessimism, leaves his home to fight in the Spanish Civil War. The story opens in 1994 as Dave is having a fatal heart attack in his Liverpool council flat. Later, his granddaughter is going through his possessions when she discovers a suitcase filled with clippings and mementos from the Spanish conflict. Included are letters from the front, and strangely, a faded red handkerchief filled with soil. The story jumps back to 1936, when young Dave, a communist, decides he will fight the fascists in Spain. When he joins the Republican workers fighting fascist soldiers in the Barcelona foothills, he finds not only a new purpose in life, but also first love, and eventually political disillusionment. Mainly in English, with sections in Spanish, German, French with sub-titles. Multi-award wining film (Cannes, Euopean Film of the Year) directed by Ken Loach.

results.title: Ladyhawke [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Warner Bros Pictures, Richard Donner and Lauren Shuler
results.brief_description: A haunting tale of magic and mysticism set in an age of enchantment and adventure. Navarre (Rutger Hauer) and Isabeau (Michelle Pfeiffer) are two lovers, condemned to spend eternity together - yet never to touch, due to the spell of that the corrupt Bishop Aquila has placed upon them. Aided by the young renegade thief, “Phillipe the mouse” (Matthew Broderick) and defrocked priest, Imperius (Leo McKern), they must find a moment in time when night and day are one - a time when evil will consume itself and the spell will be broken.

results.title: Ladybird, ladybird
results.creator_credit: Film Four International, Sally Hibbin and Ken Loach
results.brief_description: A single mother struggles against the British social service system and her own troubled past in director Ken Loach’s brutally realistic drama. Coming from a background of abuse and poverty, the hardened Maggie (Crissy Rock) has already suffered through a series of painful romances when she falls for the caring Jorge (Vladimir Vega) and they begin a loving but turbulent relationship. Their situation takes a turn for the worse when Maggie becomes pregnant, her troubled past leaving her branded an unfit mother by the government with four other children already in foster care. Determined to keep their child, Maggie and Jorge begin a difficult fight against government bureaucracy, made all the more difficult by Maggie’s volatile temperament. This is the story of a woman whose fierce maternal instincts are not enough to placate a society that places conformity over uncontrolled and unconditional love.

results.title: Lady of burlesque
results.creator_credit: Hunt Stromberg Productions, Hunt Stromberg and William Wellman
results.brief_description: Set in the late 1930s, this backstage mystery-comedy stars Barbara Stanwyck as Dixie Daisy, a burlesque artist who also arbitrates frequent disagreements between the chorus girls. When two girls are strangled with a G-string, the police point the finger at various crew members including Daisy and Biff (Michael O’Shea), a comic with designs on Daisy. Stanwyck plays Daisy as a tough-as-nails no-nonsense broad with enough chutzpah to carry the show, whose dialogue at times has a Howard Hawks-esque quality. This is a well-mounted independent production by a veteran ex-Metro producer with an authentic backstage atmosphere and directed at a fast pace by Wellman. Stanwyck sings “Take it off the E-string, Play it on the G-string” while dancing a ‘strip’ number. Also features: J. Edward Bromberg, Charles Dingle, and Frank Conroy. The film attracted an Oscar nomination for music score and Edith Head designed the costumes worn by Barbara Stanwyck. Based on a novel by the famed striptease artist Gypsy Rose Lee.

results.title: Lady Chatterley's lover
results.creator_credit: London Cannon Films, Producteurs Associes, Cine-Artist GMBH, Christopher Pearce, Andre Djaoui and Just Jaeckin
results.brief_description: Based on the famous and scandalous novel by D. H. Lawrence, a classic love story banned for over 30 years when first published. This controversial literary classic is brought to the screen by the director of “Emmanuelle”, and stars Sylvia Kristel as Lady Chatterley; rich, titled and beautiful but increasingly restless and frustrated by her passionless marriage to Sir Clifford (Shane Briant). Increasingly attracted to the handsome Mellors (Nicholas Clay), her husband’s gamekeeper, she is soon seeking physical and emotional satisfaction in a passionate affair, oblivious to the ensuing social scandal. Cast includes Ann Mitchell, Elizabeth Spriggs and Peter Bennett.

results.title: Lady and the Tramp
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Walt Disney, Hamilton Luske, Clyde Geronimi and Wilfred Jackson
results.brief_description: Lady, a pampered cocker spaniel, and Tramp, a jaunty mutt with a heart of gold, join an equally delightful cast of characters for an animated masterpiece. It’s an enthralling story, breathtaking animation and memorable songs, (written and performed by the legendary Peggy Lee) provide unparalleled romance, adventure and enchantment. Rated: G
